metadata.name: System Architecture
metadata.description: Example microservices architecture with various components and their relationships

nodes.name: Central Hub
nodes.description: Main orchestration point for all system components. Coordinates traffic flow and manages inter-service communication.

nodes.name: Data Processing
nodes.description: Handles all data transformation, validation, and business logic operations. Processes incoming requests and prepares responses.

nodes.name: Authentication
nodes.description: Manages user authentication and authorization. Validates credentials, issues tokens, and enforces security policies.

nodes.name: API Gateway
nodes.description: Single entry point for all API requests. Routes traffic, handles rate limiting, and provides API versioning.

nodes.name: Database
nodes.description: Primary data store for persistent application data. Ensures data integrity and provides ACID transactions.

nodes.name: Cache Layer
nodes.description: High-performance in-memory cache to reduce database load and improve response times for frequently accessed data.

nodes.name: Message Queue
nodes.description: Asynchronous message broker for decoupled communication. Ensures reliable message delivery and load distribution.

nodes.name: Analytics
nodes.description: Collects and analyzes user behavior and system metrics. Provides insights for business intelligence and optimization.

nodes.name: User Interface
nodes.description: Frontend service layer that coordinates rendering across multiple client applications and platforms.

nodes.name: Mobile App
nodes.description: Native mobile application for iOS and Android. Provides optimized user experience for mobile devices.
